item.title: New Day One Xbox Game Pass Game Shadow Dropped
item.description:
Descenders Next has been shadow-dropped and is now available to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscribers. This surprise addition marks the 13th new title to reach Microsoft's subscription service in July 2025, as well as the 91st Xbox Game Pass release since the turn of the year.

Developed by Dutch studio RageSquid, Descenders Next is a sequel to the 2019 downhill mountain biking game Descenders . It features two sports—snowboarding and mountainboarding—with RageSquid previously confirming plans to add more. Originally slated for an April 9 launch, Descenders Next suffered a last-minute delay, which was indefinite in nature and thus left it without a release date.

Three and a half months later, the early access version of the game has been shadow-dropped across several of its target platforms, namely PC and the latest two generations of Xbox consoles. As originally promised, the extreme sports title also debuted as a day-one Xbox Game Pass release. Descenders Next is hence now available via the Ultimate tier of Microsoft's service, as well as PC Game Pass. It also comes with Xbox Cloud Gaming support.

New and Upcoming Xbox Game Pass Games

Game

Game Pass Tier(s)

Platform(s)

Date

Notes

Descenders Next

Ultimate, PC

Cloud, Console, PC

Game Preview. Shadow-dropped after being delayed in April 2025.

Ultimate, PC

Cloud, PC, Series X/S

Oct 21

Day-one release.

The Outer Worlds 2

Ultimate, PC

Cloud, PC, Series X/S

Oct 29

Day-one release.

Subscribers who play the newly added game through their XGP membership effectively save $29.99—the current retail price of Descenders Next 's Game Preview version. The day-one build of the extreme sports title is free of DLC and there's currently no indication that any paid content is in the works. Not accounting for its soundtrack, the first entry in the franchise never received any DLC, though it was regularly updated throughout its own early access period. The same will ostensibly hold true for Descenders Next as well.

When Will Descenders Next Reach Xbox Game Pass Standard?

Because it is a day-one release, Descenders Next is not available on Xbox Game Pass Standard. Since this budget-friendly tier was introduced in September 2024, it has typically lagged at least six months behind Xbox Game Pass Ultimate in receiving day-one titles, which are no longer classified as such by the time they arrive. Microsoft is also on record as saying that day-one games may take up to a year to reach Xbox Game Pass Standard. Based on this pattern, Descenders Next could arrive in the Standard-tier library between January and July 2026.

RageSquid previously said that Descenders Next is planned to stay in early access for approximately two years. As such, there's a realistic chance that it leaves Microsoft's subscription service before exiting early access. Looking at the more immediate future, Xbox Game Pass is scheduled to lose three titles on July 31.

item.title: Pokemon GO: How To Evolve Doublade Into Aegislash (Can They Be Shiny?)
item.description:
Pokemon GO debuts Honedge during the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales event. After catching a Honedge, you can evolve it into a Doublade and then an Aegislash. But there are two different Aegislash forms: Shield Aegislash and Blade Aegislash.

You can get Honedge in Pokemon GO starting with the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales event on Tuesday, July 22, 2025, at 10 AM Local Time . In addition to 1-Star Raids, Honedge appears in GO Battle League rewards from Rank 6 , with higher chances on the premium track . After the event, it shifts to Rank 16 but still appears more often for premium trainers . That said, this evolution guide details how to evolve Honedge into Doublade and then Shield Aegislash/Blade Aegislash in Pokemon GO .

Pokemon GO: How To Evolve Honedge Into Doublade

Once you get Honedge in Pokemon GO Ultra Unlock event, you can evolve the Pokemon into a Doublade. The only evolution requirement is 25 Honedge Candies . After evolving your Honedge into a Doublade, you can then proceed to get its final evolutions.

Honedge Pokemon GO Stats

  • Type: Steel and Ghost-type
  • Maximum Combat Power: 1571 CP
  • Attack Stat: 135 ATK
  • Defense Stat: 139 ATK
  • HP Stat: 128 HP

Doublade Pokemon GO Stats

  • Type: Steel and Ghost-type
  • Maximum Combat Power: 2761 CP
  • Attack Stat: 188 ATK
  • Defense Stat: 206 DEF
  • HP Stat: 153 HP

Pokemon GO: How To Evolve Doublade Into Aegislash

After evolving Honedge into Doublade, you can then proceed to get Aegislash in Pokemon GO . While the main series games have both Shield Aegislash and Sword Aegislash variants, Pokemon GO developers have yet to introduce the ability to get them. The requirement to evolve Doublade into Aegislash is only 100 Honedge Candies .

Other Main Pokemon Series games have the Stance Change Ability , which is the main mechanism that switches the two forms. Pokemon GO is still missing the Stance Change Ability .

The developers haven't updated any other methods to change Aegislash forms.

Aegislash Pokemon GO Stats

  • Type: Steel and Ghost-type
  • Maximum Combat Power: 1803 CP
  • Attack Stat: 97 ATK
  • Defense Stat: 291 DEF
  • HP Stat: 155 HP

Pokemon GO: Can Doublade & Aegislash Be Shiny?

You can get Standard Honedge by winning Raids or through the GO Battle League, and then evolve it into a Doublade & Aegislash. But the developers haven’t yet released Shiny Honedge in Pokemon GO . Since you cannot encounter a Shiny Honedge in the game, you cannot evolve it into a Shiny Doublade and Shiny Aegislash.

Pokemon GO: How To Get Honedge Candies

You can collect the Pokemon GO Candies by catching and transferring several Honedge. Trainers might also get Honedge Candies by doing daily tasks with Honedge as their Buddy Pokemon, or by completing in-game content like featured Research tasks or more.

item.title: Final Fantasy Tactics Remaster Confirms Change Fans Will Likely Appreciate
item.description:
Characters in Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles will have more dialogue when compared to the original release. Scheduled to be released for PC and consoles in September, Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles is an extended remaster that promises to add plenty of helpful quality of life updates and improvements to streamline the popular tactical title for modern audiences.

Released in North America in 1998, Final Fantasy Tactics was the first game in the Tactics sub-series and has become a cult classic in the decades following its launch, with many fans dubbing it one of the greatest games ever made. While fans were thrilled when a Final Fantasy Tactics remaster was announced during the June 2025 State of Play presentation, not all news related to the upcoming title has been well-received, as some content has been confirmed to be missing from the game. This includes sections from The War of the Lions , the title's 2007 PSP release, which brought new in-game cutscenes and characters to the classic game. However, a new announcement may assuage some additional fears regarding The Ivalice Chronicles and its beloved characters.

In a new interview on the official PlayStation Blog, the game's director, Kazutoyo Maehiro, confirmed that some NPCs in Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles will have additional dialogue in battle, helping to flesh out the story and its characters even further. This addresses one longstanding complaint about Final Fantasy Tactics , as many who played the original often commented on the lack of meaningful dialogue after recruiting characters to the party. "While sending them into specific battles, characters like Agrias, Cid, and Mustadio speak considerably more," Maehiro revealed. The Ivalice Chronicles has also seen changes to the script, as writer Yasumi Matsuno recently confirmed that some alterations were made to account for the title's addition of voice acting.

Characters in Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles Will Have More Dialogue

While many fans of the beloved title are eager to get their hands on the remaster, some were frustrated to learn that the Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles Collector's Box doesn't actually include the game itself, despite coming with several highly sought-after goodies. This pricey version is currently out of stock, though players can currently pre-order a physical or digital copy of the title ahead of its planned release on September 30.

If the game sees positive reviews and sells enough copies, Maehiro claims that more Final Fantasy Tactics games could be on the way. Although the game is approaching its 30th anniversary, it hasn't lost any of its charm for fans, and many who picked it up back in 1998 are hoping that its story, characters, and unique gameplay will successfully strike the hearts of younger gamers later this year.

item.title: Pokemon GO: How to Get Honedge (Can Honedge Be Shiny)
item.description:
Pokemon GO continues to release the franchise's iconic pocket monsters as time rolls on, with new additions often dropping through themed in-game events or celebrations. Honedge is one such addition, which is finally being released in Pokemon GO when the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales kicks off during the Delightful Days Season.

Honedge is a Steel and Ghost dual-type Pokemon that is the first stage of a three-step evolution line, evolving into Doublade, and then again into Aegislash. Aegislash, in particular, has the unique ability to utilize two different forms — Shield Forme and Blade Forme, making it stand out as a unique Pokemon. For this reason, plenty of Pokemon GO trainers will be seeking out Honedge following its release. If you're one of the players eager to add this monster to your collection, all relevant information about how to obtain it (and whether it can be shiny) has been explained in the guide below.

How to Get Honedge in Pokemon GO

In Pokemon GO , Honedge is available for players to obtain for the first time from the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales event. This event is taking place between July 22, 2025, and July 27, 2025, as part of the Delightful Days Season . There are multiple ways in which players can obtain Honedge through the event, with the possibility of more ways of obtaining the monster potentially being added in other future events.

The first way in which players can obtain Honedge during the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales event is by participating in the GO Battle League . During this time, Honedge will appear in both reward tracks, starting at Rank 6. However, Honedge will appear more frequently on the Premium track. Additionally, Honedge will also be available from GO Battle League Tracks following the event, starting at Rank 16.

Other than that, Honedge will also be available as a 1-Star Raid Boss during the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales event . This is one of the most reliable ways to obtain the monster; if players are able to locate one as a Raid Boss, they will be guaranteed an encounter with Honedge after defeating it in the Raid battle.

Can Honedge Be Shiny in Pokemon GO?

Unfortunately, no, as of Honedge's release in the Ultra Unlock: Steel and Scales event, it is not currently available to encounter or obtain in shiny form . Naturally, this also means that its evolutions, Doublade and Aegislash, are also unavailable in the shiny variant. However, there is a possibility that shiny forms for Honedge and its evolution lines will be added further down the line, as this is the case with many previous releases.

item.title: August 19 is Going to Be a Sad Day for PS Plus Subscribers
item.description:
Tuesday, August 19 will be a sad day for PlayStation Plus subscribers, as that's when they will have to say goodbye to some of the service's heaviest hitters. PlayStation Plus gives users a few different tiers to choose from. The games that are added to the Essential tier can be kept forever as long as one stays subscribed to PS Plus, while the games that make up the Extra and Premium tiers rotate in and out of availability.

PS Plus Extra and Premium feature a huge number of games for players to check out, with their libraries updated on a monthly basis. New games are added to PS Plus Extra and Premium every month, while other games are removed from the service. Unfortunately, 2025 has not been a particularly great year when it comes to PS Plus Extra removals, as the service has seen an exodus of major games. The next batch of departures is expected to leave PS Plus Extra on Tuesday, August 19.

At least 14 games are leaving PS Plus Extra on August 19. Bugsnax , EA Sports UFC 5 , Naruto to Boruto: Shinobi Striker , RIDE 5 , Star Wars Jedi: Survivor , five Sword Art online games, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt , Top Spin 2K25 , and Vacation Simulator are all expected to be removed on that day. Now, it's always possible plans will change between now and then, but PS Plus subscribers shouldn't get their hopes up. They should assume all the games in the Leaving Soon section are getting removed on August 19 and plan accordingly.

PS Plus Games Leaving Soon (August 2025)

  • Bugsnax
  • EA Sports UFC 5
  • Naruto to Boruto: Shinobi Striker
  • RIDE 5
  • Star Wars Jedi: Survivor
  • Sword Art Online: Alicization Lycoris
  • Sword Art Online: Fatal Bullet
  • Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization
  • Sword Art Online: Last Recollection
  • Sword Art Online: Lost Long
  • The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
  • Top Spin 2K25
  • Vacation Simulator
  • Wild Hearts

What makes the PS Plus games leaving August 2025 especially disappointing is that the service is losing access to one of its best games, The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt . The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is a massive open world action-RPG that earned widespread critical acclaim at the time of its release in 2015 and even took home the coveted Game of the Year award. It being removed from PS Plus just months after GTA 5 left PS Plus is devastating, to say the least, as the Extra tier has now lost two of its best games.

Other games leaving PS Plus on August 19 are disappointing as well. Bugsnax was a launch title for the PS5 and one of the first PS5 games made available through PS Plus. Star Wars Jedi: Survivor is a brilliant blend of Star Wars and Soulslike gameplay mechanics, and Vacation Simulator is one of the few remaining VR games on the service. Here's hoping the new games coming to PS Plus Extra and Premium tiers on August 19 make up for the departures.
